---
title: "Resource"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
# Load the data
mydata <- read.table("./clean.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",")
```
## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
# Import the dataset
femDir <- mydata[mydata$director_gender == 1,]
ggplot(femDir, aes(x=startYear))+geom_freqpoly(aes(colour=director_gender), size=3)
mDir <- mydata[mydata$director_gender == 2,]
ggplot(mDir, aes(x=startYear))+geom_freqpoly(aes(colour=director_gender), size=3)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
